lines.text: [Alice has just split her pants open at the rear while on a secret spy mission]
I need assistance. I'm... exposed.
Freeze!

[in the pool frozen]
You gotta be kidding me.

[Jernigan has been hit in the groin by Alice with a crowbar when she tried to kill Alex's petmouse, Doris]
You... smacked my winkie.
Well, if you changed your shorts once in a while, maybe you wouldn't have rats in your pants.
You got hit with a book?
Books. Plural a trunk, full of books. Then a set of weights. We got hit twice, you dumb broad!

[as he sneaks into the mailslot of Alex's house]
You can run, but you can't hide, Junior!
Surprise!
[Beaupre screams while Alex sprays black paint to his eyes]
Unger. What's your position?
Heading down Washington Street.
I didn't copy. Where?
I said, I'm heading to Wuh-ah-ah-ah...
[Jernigan runs over Unger while driving]
Stop, you nitwit!
[the car stops and Unger screams, then collapses into the snow]
Heads up!
[unleashes booby trap that releases dumbbells on two criminals]

[donging is heard]
Ouch.
I had the chicken pox when Herbert Hoover was in the White House.
We are going to Chicago.
In the winter? I packed tropical.
I can't tell you how much I appreciate you hitting me with a minivan.
Never let your emotions get the best of you. You weren't paying attention. You should have been more vigilant.
You should've taken driver's ed. I'm gonna have bad knees when I'm old and I'll have Burton Jernigan to thank.
[as Alice locks them in Mrs. Hess's garage, intending to keep her from interfering]
Why are you closing the door?
I left my heart in San Francisco.
[Alex is hiding in the closet and Mr. Unger tries to unlock the door]
I'm coming for you, shorty, to pay you back for all the misery you caused me.
Mr. Unger, what are you doing?
He's in the closet. Scaring him a little, just before I grab him. And behind door number one!
[Mr. Unger opens the closet door and Alex just disappeared]
Towels.
Hmph.
I saw this door close.
Idiot.
Would I make it up? Why? What's the point? We working on commission here?

[calls out to the crooks]
You're not gonna find me up there, you big, dumb, law-breaking knuckle-heads!

[pushing the office door closed to stop Agent Stucky]
The 'it' you're referring to, is my little brother!
There's a senior citizen across the street who needs some soup and a doctor to look at her feet. There's two in our pool and one in our basement. The other one's gone.

[shows Alex the picture of Beaupre]
Is this him?
Yep.
For seven years, we've been after this guy. He always manages to slip away. Thanks.
[while Beaupre, Unger, Jernigan and Alice are sitting at the dinner table, they discuss their plans to steal Alex's toy car]
Tomorrow, whack every kid in the neighborhood. Burn them all!
[the four "spies" all stare at him]
Then look for that stupid toy car.
My thoughts keep turning to number 3026. It's within the operating radius of the toy car. It's in sight of all the houses I've been in.
[Mr. Unger and Mr. Jernigan meet Beaupre, who just found Alex's toy car, at the Alcott's house]
It's a video camera. Someone's onto us.
Do you think this really matters? Chip's in the car. We're at the airport in 45 minutes.
Where's Alice?

[as she pushes a baby stroller to the Alcott's shed]
What happened?
There's a woman in the house. I'll go back in and deal with her. Get the chip.
[Beaupre then hands Alice the car]
Hey, Alex, could you pass me the false alarms? I mean, the peas.
There are 14 houses. The toy car must be in one of them. We're going have to search them all. We'll come back when it's light.
We're gonna work houses in broad daylight?
It's the suberbs, Mr. Unger. Nobody's home during the day.
You get in that bed, young man.
Excuse me, but I saw a man in Karen Stephen's bedroom, a little older than Dad, and he was wearing butt inspection gloves.
I have warned you about that telescope. You look through it long enough, you're gonna start seeing things, whether or not they're there.
Well, I guess you have to be 35 before anyone around here listens to you.
Don't get smart with me, Alex. Sick or not, I am very angry with you. You caused a lot of trouble today. Dad and I have to replace a door at the Stephens'. Do you think we're happy about that?
I saw what I saw!
Good Afternoon, my husband and I just moved into the neighborhood.
Well what do you want a wilkie button?

[about Alex, in a sinister tone]
What a brave little fellow!
Excuse me for being a good citizen.
